review.reviewBody: Perfect for undating firmware on my cycleops magnus! Great tool! Great company!!!
review.name: Essential to have and easy to get!

review.reviewBody: Connecting my PowerTap pedals to Rouvy
review.name: Plug and play

review.reviewBody: For early morning trainer rides, I just use my phone and my training app to connect my H2. I saw that I would need this to update firmware and I wanted to be able to use by laptop as well so I went ahead and bought it. I plugged the USB into my laptop, which required a restart to finalize the installation. Then when I opened up my training app (TrainerRoad for me) it found my H2 perfectly. When I went to start a workout, I got a message that said I had no device transmitting power data, which didn't make sense because that comes from the H2 itself. I got worried I didn't do something correctly, but I just closed my app and opened it up again and all was good.
review.name: Works as Expected

review.reviewBody: Does exactly what I need it to. Super easy set up.
review.name: Works great! Perfect for calibrating my H2 trainer!

review.reviewBody: Made setting up my H2 trainer quick and easy. Works like it should.
review.name: Works like it should

review.reviewBody: Product worked well to connect H2 with laptop.
review.name: Product pairs easily and works as described

review.reviewBody: It's pretty straight forward, plug it in and, voila, you can connect your trainer to your computer. Connecting to your computer is great if you want to have more options on your Zwift rides, or whatever other software you may use, or if you just want a bigger screen to view your activity on.
review.name: Plug and Play, What More Can I Say?

review.reviewBody: Works well with Rouvy and cyclops trainer
review.name: Dongle

review.reviewBody: I have not been on my bikes in ten years. I'm using The Hammer to get back on the bike.
review.name: Great trainer

review.reviewBody: Worked extremely well to connect laptop to Cycleops Hammer and other devices!
review.name: Flawless device to connect to Hammer!

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. Soft and warm. I have 4 different colors. Would have given 5 stars but a couple of years the cuffs were changed to an elastic band in cuff. You can see in picture. Not only does this look bad its uncomfortable.
review.name: Great jacket, Why the changed cuffs?

review.reviewBody: Warm and stylish. This down hoodie is lightweight yet provides excellent insulation. Great for everyday wear
review.name: I would buy again this product again

review.reviewBody: I have two Canyonlands Full-Zip jackets bought in 2016-2017 that I absolutely love. I just bought a new one (Nov '24) and it's a completely different product. Cheap, shiny, lightweight fabric that won't last a couple of washes. Horrible craftsmanship. Looks and feels like a cheap knock-off. Be wary of positive reviews, those were probably made before quality went downhill.
review.name: Not your original Canyonlands. Terrible quality. Don't buy

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket for my dad, he loves how lightweight it is.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket!

review.reviewBody: This fleece is one of my favorites. I own four in different colors. I only wish North Face would return to logos dyed in matching colors.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Soft inside. More snug fit than expected but I like. Between fitted and loose.
review.name: Solid jacket

review.reviewBody: Also 0 stars for Back Country's return policy. Will not shop here again.
review.name: Garbage quality compared to old model

review.reviewBody: The men's Canyonlands full-zip fits true to size, is very comfortable, and provides adequate warmth for those outdoor walks on fall days. I continue to be impressed with how TNF has matured the Canyonlands line-up over the past few years (I've owned a few of these and this year's version feels like the most comfortable one yet). You can't go wrong with this gem and the only reason why I didn't rate it 5 stars is that aside from TNF Black color (which I purchased), the remaining available color selections (Olive Heather, Med Grey Heather, Shady Blue Heather) are uninterestingly pedestrian. C'mon team, these are not exciting at all. I would strongly, strongly encourage the Product Development team to make the following color options available for the full-zip version for 2025: Beetroot, TNF Blue, TNF Red, Smokey Brown, Summit Navy, Pine Green.
review.name: Excellent, but more color options please

review.reviewBody: I believe this is my fifth Canyonlands fleece jacket. I really love them for the extra chest pocket, the nice fit, and the perfect weight for fall and early winter as a mid-layer.
review.name: I would buy it again

review.reviewBody: The Canyonlands used to be my go-to zip up, but each year they have changed for the worse. The waist, cuffs and collar used to hemmed, now they use an elastic piping that is nowhere near as comfortable. They've also changed the main zipper to a finer tooth that bunches up and looks terrible. Each model change has gotten progressively worse in quality, yet more expensive. I won't be purchasing any more of these. Too bad, they used to be my favorite.
review.name: Old models were much better

name: Canyonlands Full-Zip Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Just got this Jacket and it is awesome! It fits well as I am 6’3 and bought a large. Super comfortable and love the fit of it can’t wait to get out and use it.
review.name: Can’t wait to use it

review.reviewBody: After reading the other reviews I decided to buy a L rather than XL or XXL. Surprisingly L fits me very well... I suggest ordering a size down if you plan to get this jacket. Great shell for skiing
review.name: Solid Jacket, Runs Large

review.reviewBody: Fine looking jacket but the photo and sizing chart will have you believe this jacket hugs a fit figure. I'm 6'3 and 180 lbs, regular to muscular build and I was absolutely swimming in a large. Seems to be the trend for Stoic in general. Description should warn you this is for people who are into the super baggy, non-form fitting look.
review.name: Beware the fit on this brand

review.reviewBody: @Steven L if you wanted an insulated jacket you shouldn't have purchased a "shell" jacket. Shells are not meant to be thick. I purchased my jacket recently and for the price the jacket is fine. I plan to wear it on hotter days when its not snowing. The jacket runs a little big in the arms and the hoodie area. I would probably buy a small if I could go back.
review.name: Shell Jacket

review.reviewBody: I have rain jackets that are thicker and warmer than this.
review.name: Cheap

review.itemreviewed: Aero Race 6.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
When I pulled this jersey out of the bag, it looked so undersized I checked the tag to see if I hadn't accidentally been sent a size Small. The thing's so short I thought it might be a women's model, to fit a more typically shorter female torso. Aero styling/fit notwithstanding, this isn't XL in any imaginable universe.

Nice design and seems to be well constructed, though.
review.name: Men's XL is laughably tiny

review.itemreviewed: Aero Race 6.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I usually wear a large jersey. But this jersey (large) was about 2+ times too small. I laid it on another one of my jerseys and was about 4” shorter and almost 2” narrower in the sides. Great material but I’d order a size or 2 up for this one
review.name: VERY SMALL FIT

review.itemreviewed: Aero Race 6.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I fit well within the measurements for a medium jersey but it is too small.
Purchased "on sale" but certainly won't be paying full price for a large.
review.name: Too small

review.itemreviewed: Aero Race 6.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 1st pair of Castelli's in 10 years, been off the bike for 5 now. I did my due diligence on researching for a set that will last years to come. The Aero Castelli set is way to go! I felt like I was in a time trail in the TDF the 1st ride with how snug and aerodynamic these were. I purchased this & the Castelli Free Aero Race 4 Limited Edition Bib Short Chartreuse, M (The color scheme fits perfect). While the bibs run short, which is expected on anything brand new and I know over time they will fit into form. I see all these reviews of other complaining about this or that on how tight or small they run. Well they are "Fit to Form" if you can read the Tech Specs! Meaning a tighter fit on your body. The chamois is very comfortable and forms my saddle for a perfect comfortable ride. Thank you CC for the 12 Days Special!
review.name: Excellent Jersey

name: Aero Race 6.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love the material of these pants. I wish OR had a tall option for women's pants, I'm 5'10 size small and these hit me well above the ankles
review.name: Awesome pants!

review.reviewBody: I love the way these pants feel and look. I recently bike commuted in them in the rain and unexpectedly they did great shedding water, they barely got wet at all. I love the stretchy waistband and overall fit. Being a little taller, they bottoms are a few inches above my ankles but that's fine if you're looking for that. I would love an identical option that extended another 6" or so and in a few more fun colors. I'm about 5'7" and 133# and a size S was just right to avoid a baggy look that still moved well. I always seem to fall somewhere between an OR size S and M for bottoms, though.
review.name: Very comfortable, stylish, functional

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these pants. I bought a pair 6 months ago and am buying more in case OR ever gets rid of them. I've tried the OG ferrosi climbing pants & the ferrosi leggings, but these are my favorite. I climb in them frequently and they hold up on wide cracks and sharp crystals. They look great and are so comfortable. I love that they are slightly cropped & tapered so they stay out of the way when climbing. I'm 5'4, 130lbs, & typically a size 4, & the size small fits perfect. I will buy these pants over & over again.
review.name: My Favorite Pants!

review.reviewBody: I own two pairs and highly recommend them. This style goes from day-to-day errands to casual dining to travel to hiking - an excellent multipurpose piece of clothing! I recently took a skid on a downhill abrasive, pebbly hike and thought "this is end of these pants". I was wrong - they weren't at all damaged and the rock dust just brushed off. I would love to see some more colors in muted tones - gray, drab olive green, etc. The khaki color goes with most color tops, but the green is an evergreen color that doesn't go with most of my wardrobe, just the black and white tops. I dress in dull colors that don't show travel wear.
review.name: Has been a versatile, durable pair of pants - A++

review.reviewBody: Fantastic material, amazing versatility, and functional apparel
review.name: Amazing do it all pants!

review.reviewBody: I like these pants a lot. Comfortable and easy. Looks good, even after a day of hard hiking.
review.name: Yes! Good Purchase!

review.reviewBody: I previously wrote a review stating that I exchanged these in a Size Small for an X-Small. I cannot edit that review so I am reviewing again. I am 5'7", 130 lb, 26" waist, 37" hip. The Small was much too big in the waist. The X-Small fit better in the waist but the legs were too tight. They fit more like a legging than a jogger, which is not what I wanted. These might work for someone who is more straight up and down but if you are at all curvy/have an athletic body type, the waist runs too big relative to the rest of the pant. I returned. I really wish the X-Small had been looser in the leg because I was really excited for a Ferrosi jogger. Or if they had had a waist tie, the small might have been able to work.
review.name: Runs too large in waist and small in leg

review.reviewBody: These pants are excellent. They are one of those rare finds that are perfect for travel because you can wear them for hiking during the day and then they look and feel equally suited to going out for dinner. The cut is very flattering and the material is great. The only thing I would criticise is the waist. I'm an XS size and for me the waist is too loose. The pants could do with an internal draw string or even better an integrated belt similar to the Ferrosi women's short 5" . Overall I would highly recommend these pants. They are a wonderful all-rounder and very comfortable.
review.name: Great pants, very versatile- needs an integrated belt

review.reviewBody: I haven't gotten a chance to wear these yet because I ordered a Small and needed to exchange for an X-Small. I am 5'7", 130 lb, 26" waist, 37" hip. I have the Ferrosi Legging in size Small and due to the lack of stretch in the waistband on those pants, it's a struggle to get them over my hips. However, the Transit Pants are much too large in the waist for me in size Small. The waist on these pants is VERY stretchy so if you are in between sizes, I would size down, there is plenty of forgiveness in the elastic, and there are no drawstrings (please add!) so you cannot tighten if needed.
review.name: Run Smaller than Ferrosi Legging

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable pants to wear in the outdoors, casually while out and about, and even at work! The brand logo isn't easily seen (in the green pant) so I can get away with wearing them especially during hot summer days. In my opinion, they were worth the money spent and now I want them in black!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Havent run enough but seem fine, just annoying I had to return because 8.5 which I wore for years was definitely a size too small
review.name: runs a bit small and tight

review.reviewBody:
I don't have an especially wide foot, but in my normal size my foot was so constricted across the forefoot that it cut off circulation - I still had plenty of room in the toes, so it's not that the shoe is too small all around. Sizing up ½ a size gives a snug fit across the forefoot but too much length. Nice shoe otherwise, but unwearable for me.

Salomon, one can always tighten the laces a little to get snug fit, but one can't widen the shoe. Either make this several mm wider or offer an 'E' or "wide" width version.
review.name: Too narrow.
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: Replaced Pulsar Trail with these, have to say they feel like a better shoe in every aspect, also prefer them to the Thundercross.
review.name: Favorite Salomons so far

review.reviewBody: Fits to size. Definitely not maximal cushion. Not super clear how the midsole/cushioning is different from the s/lab version. It seems to be the same in terms of specs in the descriptions and from reading other third party reviews, but the s/lab is categorized "maximal" and this model is "moderate" cushioning.
review.name: Decent first impression

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes and after breaking them in I love this shoes. It will come as no shock but the lace system never disappoints. Keeps the shoes tight while feeling comfortable the whole time. Can’t say enough good things about these shoes.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: Tried them a few times and I like. Will see in a few months if they hold up…
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: This was my first trail running shoe , I was doing 4 runs a week with it . Good grip and stability in rough terrain .
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Great grip, nice cushioning - I'd work a bit on some esthetic details but overall 5 stars!
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: I've ran long, technical efforts in a ton of different Salomon releases. This by far is the best price to quality ratio shoe that I've experienced! Enough cushion for ultra distances, great grip, softer material in the heal cup than some others (blister friendly), and just enough propulsion for a fun ride. Highly recommend and hope these features continue in the Genesis generations to come!
review.name: Love for long efforts!

review.reviewBody: The shoes are really good looking, they are well constructed but they are a very tight fit. These would be great if they made a wide version
review.name: Great shoe, too tight
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

hasVariant.name: Snug Tite Lock
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Snug Tite Lock online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: this thing is garbage, and absolutely NOT worth the money that it costs. every coming winter i would take my thule bike rack off of my car, which meant taking the snug-tite receiver lock off. and every time, without failure, it would take me like 10-15 minutes to get the key to turn enough to release the lock. the thing finally totally seized up and even after several wd-40 applications, this thing is toast. i'm pretty sure i'm going to have to cut the actual pin with some kind of grinder to get off. very frustrating.
review.name: garbage! lock completely seized up
comment: I am sorry to hear about your negative experience with the Thule Snug-Tite Receiver Lock. From the description, it sounds like the lock mechanism may have jammed after a season of use on the vehicle. Road grit and the vibrations of constant use can seize the mechanism. WD-40 can also cause further adherence in the system since it is a water displacer not a lubricant. Penetrating lubricant like white lithium grease or spray silicone are generally more useful for loosening stuck locks.

review.reviewBody:
I lost a hitch pin ...Thule graciouslyrics sent me new one, no questions, no charge, and quickly

VERY NICE AND CLASSY

THANK YOU THULE
review.name: Classy Outfit

review.reviewBody:
Great product
Feel safer with my Bike Thule Snug Tite reciever lock
thank you
review.name: Feel safer

review.reviewBody: I cannot unlock the hitch lock stl2. Noone in my family can do it either no matter how many youtubes or any other on-line instructions. I need to get the bike rack off of my car. Please help. I am about ready to destroy the bike rack to get it off of my car. Since I could not unlock the hitch, I tried to put the cap back on and cannot get it back on.
review.name: CANNOT UNLOCK THE HITCH LOCK STL2
comment:
Thank you for letting us know about the issue with your Thule Snug-Tite Receiver Lock. 
After connecting via email, I'm glad you were able to release the mechanism. If you have any further installation issues with Thule products, please feel free to contact Thule Customer Service directly for live assistance.

review.reviewBody: The bolt and lock have worked great; but it got cross threaded and neither I nor my mechanic can remove it. Since the threads are hidden, we can't just cut off the bolt head. I'm looking for ideas on how to get the lock pin system free from the trailer hitch. Can't recommend if this is going to cost me my bike rack and my hitch.
review.name: Secures bike rack from theft - but it's stuck!
comment:
Hello Karen, 
Thank you for reaching out to let us know of the issue with your Thule SnugTite Receiver lock. It looks like a Thule Customer Support agent is working with you to resolve the issue. 
If you require more immediate assistance with technical troubleshooting, please contact us directly at 800-238-2388.

review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple years ago to secure my hitch mount bike rack to the back of my travels trailer. Tried to remove it after the first season and couldn't get it to unlock, it was -10c so I assumed it was frozen and left it on the trailer for winter storage. Beginning of the next season I tried to remove it again but still could not. I needed the bike rack on our SUV this fall so spent an hour jiggling, oiling and heating with no luck so I resorted to brute force and popped the lock off the end of the bolt by simply wedging a wrench under the lock and unscrewing thee bolt from the rack... The way this is designed the lock hangs with the open hole toward the top so you are guaranteed to get water/dirt/salt inside causing it to seize. I was able to tap a bolt into he little cover plate and salvage my code-matched cylinder for something else. I will not be buying any more Thule standalone locks/cables.
review.name: Will fail you
comment:
I'm sorry about the damage to your Thule Snug-Tite Receiver Lock. 
Thule products are designed and tested to withstand adverse weather conditions, but prolonged exposure to road salt, sand, and ice-melt can corrode teh internal mechanisms of the lock. We recommend removing the lock and carrier from the vehicle to limit environmental damage, and regular cleaning and maintenance of all Thule products to ensure consistent operation.

review.reviewBody: I left my last one on my bumper and drove off...ordered and delivered fast. I would have paid more if it came standard with my Thule bike rack.
review.name: Don’t leave home without it!

review.reviewBody: The Snug Tite lock works very well. It fits properly and will keep my bicycles from being stolen. All the Thule products I have owned live up to a good reputation
review.name: Quick, Good Service, and Good Professional Work

review.reviewBody: It is odd that they call it “snug Tite” as the lock hangs on the pin loosely and not snug against the  hitch.  But I have to trust the engineering that the rack is securely held and reasonably secure from theft.  It was easy to install and seems like a well made product.
review.name: Added security

review.reviewBody: Have had less than a week but knowing the bike rack is locked is of great comfort.
review.name: Easy to install. Thus fare has worked well.

name: Snug Tite Lock

description: Buy the Castelli UPF 50+ Light Leg Sleeves online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: UPF 50+ Light Leg Sleeves
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli UPF 50+ Light Leg Sleeves online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Purchased these mainly for protection from poison oak, as I'm hypersensitive to it.  The sleeves feel cooler than expected, even on warm, sunny days; especially since I got them in black instead of white.  
I'm short, so the zipper's a bit long on me; probably should have gotten the unzippered type.   Regardless, haven't felt any discomfort while riding, and prefer these leg sleeves vs. wearing long/tall socks.
review.name: Works for me

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing them for years in peak summers as I hate putting on sun screen lotions and these leg sleeves are perfect!! I do road cycling and had no issues with them at all.
review.name: Excellent leg sleeves

review.reviewBody:
I have used these many times over the summer. It is perfect at providing sun protection. The material is light and breezy even in SC heat and humidity. Your legs move enough to provide plenty of airflow to keep them nice and cool. 
After many rides, the gripper stopped working after riding for an hour or two. The sleeve would just start slipping down my thighs and would end up around my ankles. You can pull these under your bibs to help hold them up, but I still have had problems with it slipping. 
Eventually I got a rip by the top seam. It looks like there are little holes in the fabric around the top gripper. This is where mine failed. If you look at my picture, those mini-holes are all the way around the top of both of my sleeves.
Unlike some of the other reviewers, I have not had an issue with the zipper. 
I also have the arm sleeves and those have been perfect so far! Your arms move far less than your legs, so the gripper has a better chance of working.
I ordered a large and that seemed to work for a while until I started having issues with it slipping. I did not lose any major weight during this period. For reference, my quads are 19.5" (~5" above my knee). I am a road cyclist and typically ride 2-3 hours when I am using these.
review.name: Does the job

name: UPF 50+ Light Leg Sleeves

review.reviewBody: They are great but honestly, they aren't worth the money. Talking to the backcountry gear guy, he suggested I get the Large which I did but after wearing it a couple of times I wish I got the Medium.   I was wishing I didn't have to have so many layers buying these but I wear the exact same as I did before which is a bust.  I would save my money and go with something cheeper as it does the same job.
review.name: Not worth the money

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are amazing mens baselayer with good fit. As someone with large quads and booty they are not too tight. Bought them to go skiing, hikes in the cold, and even walking around town with a pair of jeans or joggers when it got down to the low 10s F. Kept me warm throughout. Fought off the stink. Found myself wearing these around the house as well on those cold nights...
review.name: Warm, comfy

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: I?ve worn these base layers in very cold temperatures below 0 and kept my body heat in so well! It does not itch and is super comfortable to wear! I will definitely be purchasing the 150 line bc I only wear the 250 when it?s 20 degrees or below Fahrenheit. I get pretty warm if the temperature is near freezing or little above.
review.name: Very warm

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm and moisture wicking, never have used merino wool before, really liking it
review.name: Super warm

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: These pants just get the job done. They add a ton of warmth, and I wear them on cold resort snowboarding days or long, cold hikes in the wintertime. Wool ensures they don't smell even after multiple days of hiking in them. My only complaint is the fit. These pants just make you look like you have a diaper hanging from your butt .
review.name: Keeps you warm, but looks saggy

name: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
Smartwool Men's Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom | GH Review

review.reviewBody:
Solid construction so can't complain. Be aware that XS only comes with 2 backpack straps. 

If you're looking for a traditional single-strap over the shoulder carrying method, you'll need to get an after market strap to hook it up yourself. It also doesn't come with handle straps (just handle loops).
review.name: Note the straps and handles

review.reviewBody: Best duffle for short flights. I got 4 days of clothes in this bag and it was small enough to be considered my "personal item" on a flight.
review.name: Perfect size and indestructible.

review.reviewBody: Love it so much I bought one for the whole family. 3-4 days packed into my personal item on my flight.
review.name: Last a lifetime of abuse.

review.reviewBody: I love the ruggedness and size of this bag. My only complaint is the main zipper on the XS size bags; they are less beefy than the larger sized bags and have a tendency to gap and bind.
review.name: Nice bag, underperforming main zipper

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and really usable for any occasion. The material is great for rainy days too! Totally love it
review.name: I totally recomed!

review.reviewBody: I wanted this bag for a while, and I'm super happy with it, it's great for a weekend trip somewhere, good quality and visually standout (in yellow particularly)
review.name: Great item, would recommend!

review.reviewBody: The bag is a must have. It's built with great quality and looks good.
review.name: Greatest bag

review.reviewBody: Can't beat it, simple and tough. It's a bag that can really take a hit and the xs is a perfect size for an overnight weekend bag.
review.name: Simple and Proven

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag for myself. The bag is great and the perfect size of getting around. Its easy to store and the quality is good and built well.
review.name: BEST LIL DUFFEL

review.reviewBody: Very good quality. Love the compartments for smaller items like chargers and etc. great for traveling and not having to pay for carry on.
review.name: Yes - good purchssd

name: Base Camp XS 31L Duffel Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Nevadan Down Parka - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm in the 30s easily with just a normal shirt and a sweater. With real layers I have been able to walk approx 30 minutes round trip in the low 20s and strong winds. It’s very warm and also gives you that psychological warmth boost of a fat, cozy puffer. The length is just right if you need a big outermost layer but don’t want a full parka length. I am normally between S and M for most things and a S easily fits me even with a chunky sweater. The two internal mesh pockets are clutch.
review.name: Good choice for your one puffy coat

review.reviewBody: This is the jacket of my dreams. MH stuff always fits me great which is nice, but with this fantastic looking and feeling down jacket you also get TWO chest pockets, TWO inside chest mesh pockets, and an adjustable hood strap that makes the hood fit perfecting. great jacket
review.name: MH nails it with this one

review.reviewBody: Great easy to wear classic down jacket. Lots of pockets. Runs big for layering, Ill be using  it for car camping, etc.
review.name: Classic down jacket.

name: Nevadan Down Parka - Men's

description: Buy the Icebreaker Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This works as a base layer or an outer layer, warm, comfort and looks great. Stands up to machine washing, much easier than i expected to hand wash. Airdried quickly, no wrinkles snags or pills. The fit selector was spot on. Wore for a week solid through a power outage and looked fresh at the end.
review.name: Absolutely love it

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved the purple "Magic" color but the new neckline is way too high. It's uncomfortable and rubs against the neck in an irritating way. I had to return it. I hope they return to the previous version neck line or offer a scoop or V-neck.
review.name: New neckline too high

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this shirt. IB makes good quality 100% merino shirts.
review.name: Cool design and good quality of merino fabric

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great shirts. Unlike some of the base layer shirts, I can wear these as EITHER a base layer OR as a normal tee - they are thick enough not to show off what's underneath. Time will tell if they are as durable as a thicker fabric.
review.name: Light, comfortable, good-looking.

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I discovered merino wool clothing this past spring. I have slowly been trying products from different companies. This t-shirt is far superior to any other that I have tried. I love it and have worn it every day since receiving it. It has all the benefits of merino wool like never smelly and needing washed less often than cotton or synthetic. While none of my merino wool clothing has been itchy, this shirt just has an extra smooth feel against my skin that I adore.
review.name: My new favorite shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great, true to size, seems to be durable although I'd only worn it a few times.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and true to size! I'll be buying more Icebreaker merino wool!
review.name: Perfect layer for our recent trip to the Pyrenees!

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear my Icebreaker Merino Tech Lite 11 short sleeve for exercising, walking, lounging and just about everywhere. It's soft, doesn't get smelly.. Could be slightly shorter, but I chose medium as I prefer slightly loose fit.
review.name: Shirt delivers comfort in spades

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far so good. Extremely soft and comfortable. Like the slightly tailored fit and the length! Nice neck. I haven't washed it yet but if it is true to icebreaker form...should be fine.
review.name: Liking it

review.itemreviewed: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have many of these Merino wool t-shirts for travel. They wear very well and work in basically any climate. Keep me warm when I am chilled. Keep me cool when it might be a little warm. Love the solid colors and the ones with a graphic.
review.name: Love these T-shirts

name: Tech Lite II Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the DMM Dragon Cam Set online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love everything about these. If you can't afford a rack of totems, these are the next best option. 

Plus it's just cool showing up at the crag and saying, "I'm bringing my dragons."
review.name: Yeah, but I've got Dragons

review.reviewBody: I think it's fair to say that these are the best cams I have ever had the privilege of using. Me and some friends borrow some for a desert trip, and they did not disappoint.  They are grippy and smooth, and bomber. Not mention the extendable sling, which rocks, and the lack of a thumb loop. I know some people dont like it, but I really enjoy not having a thumb loop.
review.name: These just might be my favorite cams

name: Dragon Cam Set

review.reviewBody: Simple design (no metal snaps brrrrr!) with warm 100% merino wool material. The fabric is thin but amazingly warm for outside activities, or as a liner for waterproof mittens. My hand is glove size 7.25 and I bought a medium which fits just right. These mittens clip together and can be conveniently stashed in a handbag or pocket.
review.name: Simple design

review.reviewBody: I got these mittens for hiking and I'm using them all the time now. Super practical, ultralight, and warm. They're easy to stuff in a bag when you're not using them.
review.name: LOVE these mittens!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was hoping these would be a bit warmer, but they are nice to have for cold mornings. They run a bit short in my opinion. I got a medium and I'm 5'8" woman.
review.name: Nice but thin

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Some of my favorite gloves/mittens. I love that they're convertible from fingerless to mittens and they're super warm for their weight.
review.name: Warm and light weight

review.reviewBody: Color was horrible sent them back for an exchange but I have not gotten an email on the exchange being completed or anything shipped to me. So keep your tracking number if you do a return so you can find it otherwise you are at their mercy. See what happens if I get my money back or the shoes I was exchanging fir
review.name: Shoe design is great

review.reviewBody: Trim around the toe area started peeling within a month
review.name: Peeling toe area

review.reviewBody: Nice shoe but the trim around the toe started peeling within a month
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I got these a few days ago, and I have to say, the design is what Ive liked most about them. The colors are super cool - bold and subtle at the same time, so they're cool to wear for different occasions. They have a great modern vibe that catches attention without being too flashy, which I love. Quality-wise, these shoes are rock-solid like all Hokas Ive had. You can really feel the attention to detail in every part of them. The materials feel premium, and there's this reassuring sturdiness to them that tells me they'll hold up well, even with regular wear. I've walked quite a bit in them, and so far, they're showing no signs of wear and tear. The fit is snug and supportive, and walking around, I never have to worry about slipping or sliding. You can tell they've been designed more for outdoor adventures, although they feel ok at the gym, or just walking around the city. That said, I do wish they were a tad more comfortable. Don't get me wrong, they're not uncomfortable by any means, but they don't have that extra cushy feel that some of the brand's other models have. If you're used to that soft, almost bouncy comfort, these might feel a bit firmer. Overall, I'm pretty happy with these sneakers. They look awesome, feel durable, and give me a lot of confidence when I'm out and about. Just wish they had that extra bit of comfort to make them perfect.
review.name: Great on many fronts!

review.reviewBody: Great feel and traction. This my second pair in a month. Unfortunately for the first time in 4 pair of Hoka shoes that I had a quality issue. The front toe protection covering began to peel away. Dick's Sporting Goods excepted the return and I bought a second pair from the Hoka website.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I like the looks , the comfort is not a 100 % , feel tight and the shoe laces become untie pretty frequently
review.name: Maybe too much hype

review.reviewBody: Comfortable on a ten mile hike right out of the box. The only negative is those darn slippery round laces that wont stay tied, even when double knotted. And you cant change them out for flat laces because the lace guides are sized just for these round laces.
review.name: Wonderful except for those darn slippery round laces

review.reviewBody: Loved Hoka since the very beginning. Unfortunately, had to return this pair. Ever since Hoka has been acquired by Deckers quality of it changed tremendously. Sole is made from much harder materials then original One One. Also design of new Hokas now is the same as any other brand of sneakers: narrowed toward the toes as opposed to be rounded to give more room for the foot. This was my third purchase of Hokas after acquisition. Previous two pairs (recovery and anojara) I can not wear. I have decided that three times was a charm. Company leans toward increasing the variety of colors and gave up on comfort. There is also a discrepancy in sizing.
review.name: Maybe my last Hoka purchase

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable I work retail so I am on my feet 10+ hours a day. I switched to these from the speedgoat I really like how these seem to have a good cushion. My only negative is the laces they are impossible to keep tied. I would rate the laces 1 star.
review.name: As always another comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: Not enough wide sizes. Had to make due with what was available. Not a great fit ! Not great for any activity, Due to poor fit.
review.name: Insultingly expensive

name: Skyline-Float X Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes ahead of a spring break trip. I ordered a size 40, which I wear in Birkenstock boots. I had them on my feet for about 60 seconds and determined they were too large. I immediately boxed and returned the shoes- they were shipped back within 24 hours of receipt. Backcountry.com is refusing to refund my credit card stating the item my returned is used. They have done this on several clothing items as well though they have been returned with tags and in their plastic packaging. I attempted to call customer service, which is internationally outsourced, and was told items were documented as received and used condition. Absolutely not the case. I asked for photographs as proof of used condition. They had none  Will not shop from backcountry.com in the future they are not an honest company.
review.name: Buyer beware of dishonest returns dept

name: Bend Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Echo fabric is the greatest base-layer material out there. It's amazing in high heat conditions as well as the first of multiple layers for cold weather.
review.name: Greatest base-layer material out there

review.reviewBody: I love these. The Echo line of long/short sleeve and tanks are my absolute favorite OR product. The fit is great. I’m 5’5” and athletic. I work out to look and feel good and so often the clothes I find from retailers are made for guys 6 feet plus with a flat chest and no butt. Not so this product. I buy a size small and it fits perfectly. It’s great for working out or working on the farm. It wicks moisture and protects me from the sun. I have the echo short sleeve and echo tanks too. My only wish is that they’d offer more bright colors.
review.name: The fit is fantastic

review.reviewBody: I got this for my husband after purchasing many OR Echo pieces for myself. The material is almost magical. It is very comfortable and so lightweight and cooling. Way better than any other ultra lightweight hot weather gear.
review.name: Super lightweight and cool

review.reviewBody: I got this as a gift for my friend and he wore it while doing a multi-day hike in the Alps. It worked great! It's light weight, so easy to carry on a long hike, warm and comfortable. Highly recommend this shirt!
review.name: Lightweight and warm for long-distance hiking

review.reviewBody: Light weight, cool, especially for keeping sun off arms even in summer.
review.name: Excellent sort even for summer

review.reviewBody: Perfect top for layering. Provides warmth, is light and comfortable. The color is great too. Using this mostly for hiking and camping.
review.name: Perfect for layering!

review.reviewBody: I wear this as a casual piece but also as a wicking piece when biking.
review.name: Great shirt for all activities, light and airy, works on hot

review.reviewBody: This is one of the most comfortable shirts, both for activities and lounging about. Light weight with good sun protection. (Never been sun burn) Outside, it keeps me warm down to about 60°F while walking/hiking, and cool up to about 80°F. If it's full sun outside, I switch to the hoody, but I prefer this version. This top also makes a good base layer under a jacket when temps are in the 50s.
review.name: I love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: I have a chronic skin condition that demands that I cover up my skin. I am able to walk in complete comfort in your long sleeve tee....even in the Texas heat. This shirt allows me to be completely covered AND cool! Don't know how you do it, but it is amazing and allows me to walk every day!!!
review.name: Couldn't go out without it!

review.reviewBody: I got this shirt as a gift, my wife has a bunch of them and suggested it for warm weather sun protection. It's nice and light material, definitely good for the summer and not adding another heavy layer. It's nice to have an alternative to sunscreen. My only complaint is that the body is a perfect width for me but the arms and the body length are a bit short. For a brand focused on active people, they should know that thin/narrow people can still be tall!
review.name: Nice and light for easy sun protection

name: Echo L/S Tee - Men's

description: Buy the ThirtyTwo Bandito X Christenson Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bandito X Christenson Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the ThirtyTwo Bandito X Christenson Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Bandito X Christenson Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
So I'll start with the good.  It's an exceptionally comfortable boot accept that it run at least a size or size and half small.  I wear a size 10 in most shoes, but ended up settling on the 11.5.  It's nice and flexible for a surfy style of riding and very easy to walk in.

Getting strapped in take a bit longer than Boa style and it's a bit bulky, although I added the heel cups that came with the boot.

Now for the bad.  I bought the boot in the fall and after a month of riding the inner lacing broke.  I would have been fine if ThirtyTwo or Backcountry helped me replace the broken lacing.  But instead they have played ping pong with me and I've heard nothing back after repeated attempts to reach them.  This would never happen at another retailer.    I've had to go and buy new boots elsewhere.  I'd be more than happy to talk to someone if they still want to reach me.  But it's been crickets.
review.name: Backcountry/ThirtyTwo have ghosted me

name: Bandito X Christenson Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's

review.reviewBody: I did my research and this parka is the most comfortable and warm parka I own and I own several quality parkas. Worth the money.
review.name: Very light and warm!

review.reviewBody: This a great jacket. Perfect for the winter. I love the length of it.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: This parka is an everyday wear for me. I have been able to wear a t-shirt underneath in 30 degree weather and feel warm. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great puffer

review.reviewBody: Couple of things. This did run big for me. I wear an xl in everything and had to size down to a L. Also it's more of a parka, if you like back coverage, you will like this. The stretch is really nice on this too, really lets you move. The hood is a good size, not to small or big and it stays in place. Good amount of pockets, which is good for my uses. The fabric has a nice hand to it also, much softer than your normal puffer. My one gripe is the hand pockets are only lined on the side facing the back of my hand. I would have like the whole pocket to be lined for when I run out without gloves. Outside of that, this jacket is a ticks a lot must haves for me.
review.name: One of my favorites

review.reviewBody: Very warm fits just right. Not to big or loose perfect for cold night
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: My husband loves this parka - he loves all of the pockets, the length and the color.
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody: This is comfortable and cozy.  Looks bulky but feels great to do errands or head off for quick walk!
review.name: comfy and warm!

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket. Fit is good and extremely warm too. Just after showing down the temperature dropping into the 20's and we got a N.E. wind.
review.name: Just in time

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a true gamechanger. the material has an incredibly soft hand and the 4-way stretch provides comfort and mobility on the trail. I truly love this thing!! It's a staple in my closet.
review.name: Most comfortable down jacket I've owned

review.reviewBody: The Stretch down Fabric is excellent for warming up on Cold Days and durable enough to keep up with heavy use and movement. I'm never concerned about ripping seams if i'm doing arm swings or easier climbs to get warmed up.  The Jacket is also very warm and perfect for long belays or rests in between tries.
review.name: Excellent movement and warmth

name: Stretchdown Parka - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Scott Voodoo NTN Telemark Ski Boot - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
There are basically two NTN tele boots available. I bought both the Scott Voodoo and the Scarpa TX Comp. Neither fit me correctly. Bought both to have my boot fitter check. From the recommendation of my boot fitter (40 years of experience, they're no slouch) I kept the Scotts. Even after EXTENSIVE boot work, I get too much toe pinch. But because of where the bellows is, they can't punch the boot any more without destroying the bellows and compromising the boot. 

We kept this boot because it had enough room in the heel and the arch. The SCarpa fit better in the forefoot. But because of how the boots are designed, the Scarpas couldn't be made to fit. 

If you have wide feet and tall arches, unfortunately, there isn't an NTN tele boot available for you. 

Hot. Garbage. 
I am going back to my 75mm tele setup.
review.name: Garbage.

name: Voodoo NTN Telemark Ski Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: What more can I say? These bars are zero, sleek and get the job done! Easy to install and will last a lifetime.

review.reviewBody: Product looks great, but In the pictures of the product it shows the mounts or towers included. I'm new to car rack terminology, and it wasn't clear that the mounts were not included, so too expensive and too late for me to use for my trip. Very disappointed in misleading description.  When chatting with customer service, they didn't know the correct towers for my car to suggest, and they were very unhelpful.  Also, the 15 % disc on newsletter signup had responded with it not being available to me. After ordering full price, I found they had sent the discount code after all, but it was too late. Poor communication overall for Backcountry.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I wear these shoes nearly every day in the winter in Chicago. 

The deep black suede looks sleek and works perfectly against snow, sleet, and rain. The grip on these shoes on the ice is decent. I love that they are light weight and cushioned well. 

I ordered a size 8 and feel as though they stretched a bit after the initial wear to an 8.5 if not 9. I am a size 8.5, so these fit me perfectly. No rubbing or break-in period. Plenty of space in the foot bed and toe box.

Highly recommend the purchase, though consider buying a half size down.
review.name: Live-in Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes are light weight comfortable enough. Due to foot sensitivity it would be great if softer linings were available.
review.name: Good walking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They run large - makes my feet look huge they are comfortable however I have to wear very thick socks
review.name: They run large
comment: Hello Culatter, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ Breakthru Acadia Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a cool looking shoe and the comfort would have been great, but it felt tight for my wide size 11 foot. Even though the shoe was tight across the ball of the foot, the heel still slipped slightly. Had to return.
review.name: Narrow Fit

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had 2 pair of these boots for a year and still love them. We live in the rainy PNW, so dry feet are a must. These are my “Seattle Day” shoes when going into the city. They are sturdy,  super comfortable with ample foot cushioning, and most of all, DRY with their waterproofing. I like that the sole and heel give me a little height as I walk thru the city areas, and the grip is great for wet/slushy days.
review.name: City shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were a great buy! They are super comfortable, fit accordingly to usual size. I wear them both as a shoe at work and as boots. I am on my feet all day and I usually take my shoes off right away when I get home, but I find myself not wanting to take these off and wear them all night around the house! We have very cold winters where I live and they have kept my feet warm outside! I would highly recommend these shoe boots!
review.name: Love these shoes/boots!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable  great looking waterproof  Love these boots.
review.name: Wear light socks not for wide feet  I find them very comfortable great for walks  They look great. I will wear them in snow The treads are great and safe

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good fit and fun design. The shoe catches attention and is different and dynamic.
review.name: Interesting shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a waterproof bootie that could withstand a lot of walking. This is the perfect choice! I got them in tan and in black. Sporty looking. Both match trench coats that I have in my closet. I expect to be wearing them a lot in the rainy season. I'm very pleased with my purchases!
review.name: Comfortable and waterproof!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these as a dressier looking boot for my upcoming trip to Switzerland, Germany & Amsterdam. They are very warm and comfortable. Very happy with my purchase. You can’t beat Sorel for quality & comfort!
review.name: Dressier boot, excellent tread quality, waterproof & warm

name: Kinetic Breakthru Acadia WP Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Alpine Sender Dry Rope - 8.7mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Always glad to see them getting lighter and lighter! So far I've only taken this rope on one trip (multipitch in Red Rock) so I cannot speak to durability, but it handled well and was nice and light to carry.
review.name: Great light rope

review.reviewBody: This rope is light and has a great feel. It’s easy to work with and runs smoothlv through devices.
review.name: Alpine Star

review.reviewBody: I have had two sets of these ropes and have used them for both alpine trad routes and ice climbing. Would recommend.
review.name: Great Alpine and Ice climbing ropes

review.reviewBody: got these specially for a week long trip to Ouray.  keeping them as Ice only ropes.  Really noticed how water repellent they were on the first day! my older 60 and 70M ropes immediately ice over compared to these
review.name: love the dry coating

review.reviewBody: Climbing in the Canadian Rockies I love that these are triple rated. If Yam eats one of your ropes, you can use the other as a single! They are not the lightest doubles but due to their versatility they are a staple in my gear closet. I've used them in the alpine, climbing, and during glacier travel.
review.name: Great for a Multi purpose

review.reviewBody: One of the best lightweight ropes I've ever used.   Stays nice and dry on the ice and has great durability.
review.name: Great rope

review.reviewBody: top end score for a rope that handles well, is versatile and ready for use on long alpine climbs. this rope pairs well with another of the same or with a tag line if you really trying to save weight on a long mission. thanks Mammut
review.name: Light and has you back when you need it.

review.reviewBody: Nice handling skinny rope without the bulk.  Its nice having a light weight low bulk rope for long approaches, this rope is only a little heavier than a single twin.  This rope has that Mammut feel and handling.  Was disappointed that it had taped ends instead of the round burnt ends with the print rope info typically found with Mammut ropes.
review.name: Slender single line

review.reviewBody: use it in a twin rope system for ice climbing. awesome rope, can always climb confidently with it. I prefer 8.7 as its a bit lighter than the 9's and im not comfortable risking falls on 7.5mm ropes, so the 8.7 is the perfect in between with a reliable rope that I trust while still managing weight.
review.name: sweet rope!

review.reviewBody: I've used Mammut ropes since 1973, in the Rockies, in the Alps, in the Sierra, in Alaska and the last, handle well and provide all the protection you need.
review.name: 50 years with Mammut ropes

name: Alpine Sender Dry Rope - 8.7mm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used the bag on a flight for a hike. It’s a nice bag. Yes like everyone else says, where the water bladder would go is so tight. If your bag is full, there’s no way a bladder is fitting. Fits comfortably
review.name: I used the bag on

review.reviewBody: I have always carried Gregory Packs and I thought they fit well. Until I tried the Tempest 20 L Extended Fit. I cannot believe a pack can be so comfortable! I can fit everything I need for a day hike with room to spare. It didn't come with a water bladder so I use the bladder from my Gregory pack which works great. At the end of a recent hike, we sat down to eat and my husband asked me if I was going to take my pack off. I actually forgot I was wearing it! Best pack I have ever owned for a plus size, short woman. And I love that it is black. I do not like girly colors. Now I am holding my breath for Osprey to make an Extended Size of the Sirrus 34 L or 36 L. Please! Thank you for making packs for the ""not so average sized"" hiker.
review.name: Finally

name: Tempest 20L Extended Fit Pack - Women's

hasVariant.name: Super DH Mips Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bell Super DH Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've had this helmet for several years now and since I've fortunately not fallen on my head as of yet, this is strictly a comfort/fit/convenience review. I've got a 57cm melon with a narrow face and the medium is a perfect fit. The helmet is super comfortable in both functions. Once you change out the jaw bone a few times it becomes very easy to do without removing the helmet. I usually clip the chin protection to a strap on my pack if I'm going uphill, or if it's a longer easy section. I'm in San Diego and it gets hot on the trails in the summer, but the helmet is very breathable for having it's level of protection. Highly recommend if you're looking for one helmet to do it all.
review.name: Long time owner

review.reviewBody:
I got this helmet in a Medium and in a discontinued grey and hi-viz colorway (see my pics). My hat size is 7 3/8" and the medium fits TIGHT. Not so tight that it gives me a headache even after wearing it for over an hour; but I don't have to click the tightening wheel in the back very much and even the thinner cheekpads are pretty snug. 
I ordered the Super Air R at the same time but the chin bar on the Super DH felt much more solid. Although the Super Air R is as light and comfortable as all the reviews say. I could almost even forget I had it on. 
This isn't a cheap lid, but it feels really safe and secure. Plus the included GoPro mount attaches on really securely and I'm confident it would stay on through anything, except a crash of course.
review.name: Great helmet. Chose it over the Air R

review.reviewBody: The versatility of this helmet is great.  I love having a dh rated full face helmet to use on park days.  Being able to pull the chin guard off and do regular rides is great.  I love not having to worry about lugging 2 helmets with me on bike trips.  The magnetic buckle is also a great feature.  Now for the bad.  Bell seems to have discontinued the replacement liner pads.  I had a defect where the front flap of the liner detached and needed replacing.  Since I couldn't find a new liner the great folks at Backcountry opted to replace the helmet for me.  Thats great customer service!
review.name: Almost perfect but..

review.reviewBody:
I have Troy Lee half, Fox full and now this Bell transition helmet. During the muddier sloppier PNW rides ive had a few spills but never wanted to schlepp a full face with me. This is the best of both. I only have about 9hrs in this helmet so far, but have been really pleased so far. I swapped out the cheek pads for the smaller pads and I am less schmoosh faced! I have a size small and wasnt thrilled with the first ride with the thicker pads, waaaaay better with the smaller pads. The helmet breaths well, but honestly it has been cold and wet on each ride I have done, so can not say how hot it will be in summer. I am not good putting the chin bar back on yet, so annoyingly I need to remove the helmet to put the bar on. It is a cinch to take off. But with cold fingers I have struggled a little getting the chin bar on. But the more I use it the more I will be familiar with it. 
For more aggressive DH riding I would still wear my full face. But this helmet is great for adding a bit of protection, especially on the days I ride alone. The cost does seem spendy but the helmet is really comfortable, feels sturdy and the features are great. Plus it is likes 2 helmets in one. 

**image is with the larger pads.
review.name: Does what it needs to do

review.reviewBody: I'm on my second Super DH and have to say I really dig it.  My first one endured everything from bike park shenanigans to smooth local flow trails and it was always comfortable, reasonably vented, and light enough for even four hour jaunts in the mountains.  In fact, I hardly ever found myself removing the chin bar, other than Pisgah/DuPont climbs.  The inner padding wore out after a couple years, but Bell sent me new ones for free, no questions asked (awesome). Only reason I'm on Super DH number two is a recent face plant and subsequent drag on wet roots and hard pack - the helmet held up just fine with zero cracks or external evidence of damage, even as the chin bar plowed dirt into my mouth, but figured it was a hard enough hit to take no chances.  BTW, I tried a TLD Stage, too, to shake it up, but just didn't fit my noggin shape.
review.name: Second round

name: Super DH Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Primus Omnilite TI Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Omnilite TI Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Primus Omnilite TI Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used all white gas stoves on the market and this one takes the cake. Crazy light, adjustable, high powered. Did I mention light? I had the steel version of this stove for 20 years before it finally didn't cut it in subzero temps. Stoked to get this one, it's a big upgrade.
review.name: Best White Gas Stove on the Market

review.reviewBody: I am a German cyclist traveling from Alaska to Argentina. Since my old stove broke down in Oregon after 15 years, I bought this stove as a replacement. After 1.5 months, it stopped working after I had to switch to gasoline in Mexico. This is not an expedition stove, it's just a joke! I am now switching to MSR stoves and will no longer buy Primus.
review.name: Desaster

review.reviewBody:
I don't write reviews often at all, but this is a great stove!  I've used it on multiple winter trips for melting snow and 2-3 week packrafting trips throughout Alaska.  This stove is rock solid and is my goto stove for just about any trip.  I always run the stove on Coleman fuel or kerosene (I hate iso butane canisters), with a preference for kerosene and use a small amount of alcohol to preheat the stove instead of using the stove fuel to prime - this reduces the sooty mess that collects on the stove when priming (also helps keep the fuel nozzle clean).  There seem to be many folks that have issues with the jet clogging, that is usually because there is a small amount of machining grease on the control valve spindle in new stoves that have one (Dragonfly, Nova, Polaris, Omnifuel etc,).  Those spindles will make debris in the stove body when burned, so you really need to burn in a new stove for a few minutes then strip the control valve and clean it before heavy use.   Also the cleaner/pricker just pushes crap back into the stove, if it's clogging a lot you might have a bigger particle than the nozzle opening - remove the jet and shake the stove out.   You just don't notice that as much on stoves with an internal shaker/cleaner.

Primus support is top notch.  I purchased a 10 year old Omnifuel used that had a leak in the pump, when I called and asked for a single o-ring they sent me a new pump.  Another time, I asked for a spare burner bell so I could leave my silent cap in one, they sent me an entire burner bell, stove body, and control valve for fee.

I've used many other stoves MSR  Dragonfly, whisperlite, SVEA 123, older Primus/Optimus brass kerosene stoves (numbers 00, 96, 210).  This stove is the one that I would pick over the lot for any trip I go in in Alaska during the winter.
review.name: Great Expedition Stove

name: Omnilite TI Stove

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: picked this up on recommendation from Jeff Pelletier on youtube, been trying to get into more long distance trail running and ultras and my god being able to refill straight from a cold mountain steam and drink icy water safely is kind of heaven, would definitely reommend
review.name: cold mountain spring water has never tasted so goo

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody:
I have mixed feelings about this flask.
Pros: 
- Squeeze filtration bottles are great.
- It's convenient to have a filtration flask that fits in my salomon vests.

Cons:
- Top is very hard to take off - the mouth of the bottle is soft, and it's difficult to grip the bottle and twist.
- It would be nice to have a cap over the mouthpiece - it's really easy to get water you're trying to filter on the part you have to put your mouth on. Katadyn flasks have a cap that flips on and off).

I have been using the Katadyn filter and lid screwed into the Salomon flask, which works just fine, but feels a bit silly.
review.name: Okay flask, could be improved
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: Great way to lighten up the hydration jacket for long rides!
review.name: Nice to have

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: Bought it for a long hike/trail run of 50k with no aid stations. Absolutely perfect and well designed
review.name: PERFECT

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: great flask, great for backpacking and long trail runs to stay light
review.name: great flask

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: Being able to filter eat on the fly is so great. I used to carry liters of extra water and now I don’t have to.
review.name: Must have for mountain running

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: It’s okay overall. A couple things: (1)when the bottle isn’t full of water, you have to push water up with hands to be able to drink; (2)the handle seems to be unnecessary extra weight. I haven’t decided if I’ll use this for my next race because of (1).
review.name: Does its job
comment: Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. The need to manually push water up when the bottle is not full is a common characteristic of soft flasks, as they rely on the user's hand pressure to dispense the water. We will consider your feedback on the handle design for future product improvements.

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: great compact filter to keep you going light and fast in the hills. all you need is one (and some water sources along the way)
review.name: uh yeah, clean water scores a five

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bottle! It was so much fun to be able to use it at a stream while on a long run in the Olympic mountains. I needed it to help refill my water, and I was so glad I made this purchase. The flow is great; mildly slower than the normal Salomon flasks. No complaints at all!!! I'll have to pick up at least one more soon. Highly recommend!
review.name: Lifesaver!

review.itemreviewed: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: I just did the GR54 with a minimal 3.5kg (base-weight) pack and that was possible, in part, to the XA Filter in my Adv Skin 12 vest. I may only have left the refuge or gite with 1 litre of water, but being confident that I could refill safely from sources en route made life easier.
review.name: Perfect solution to minimising carry weight

name: Soft Flask XA Filter 490ml Water Bottle

I find the built-in belt super comfy and convenient, although it doesn’t slide easily on the bone color pair (the green pair’s belt works well). Overall I’m impressed and will probably pick up more styles from this brand in the future.

hasVariant.name: eeBARKEEP
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cane Creek eeBARKEEP online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These won't save you any weight over sticking to the "free" plugs that come with bar tapes and they take more time to install properly. But hey, they look neat I guess. If you want to bling out your bike a bit then these are for you.
review.name: Save Your Money

review.reviewBody:
From the viewpoint of a product design engineer, these are terrible! They don't work at keeping your handlebar tape end tucked into the bar end... When you insert them, the o-ring wants to walk out, and if you manage to get them inserted without the o-ring coming off, they squeak and spin and don't stay put when you tighten them. From a design perspective, and aluminum screw on aluminum spider is a terrible idea! The screw should be stainless or titanium! Look at the picture, you can see the screw material being cleaved off by the anodized spider. This is a terrible design. 

Do not waste your money ($40!!!!) and just use the cheap plastic "shove-in ones. 

They are nicely machined and quite pretty though...
review.name: Wow, these are terrible!

name: eeBARKEEP

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this snowboard bag for a month and a half, use it on two ski trips, and it’s already coming apart at the seams. I’m super disappointed with this snowboard bag and I will never buy one of these from Burton again..
review.name: Poorly made garbage

review.reviewBody:
I loved this bag when it first arrived. It can actually fit two boards nicely, boots and even helmet if needed. Much more space than the specs say BUT the quality of the shell is poor! Looks great but will not get through much travel if you are looking for a travel bag. First time traveling to Colorado with this seemed great until I noticed a small hole. Backcountry was phenomenal and provided a replacement with expedited shipping so I could get it for my Oregon trip. The new bag was great and seemed to make it to Oregon fine but that trip back it looked like a bobcat went at it! I know much of this was TSA and the luggage handlers but it should handle one trip better than this! It had two dime sized holes and 3 smaller holes plus a long tear that started to spread. I am going back to Oregon in 3 weeks and I know for a fact it would rip up if I took it out.

I just wanted to give my honest review for those looking for a travel bag. This review is by no means to knock down Backcountry. They are assisting me with a replacement for a better bag as we speak.

Sorry Burton, you need to step it up!
review.name: Comfy/spacious but lacks quality control

name: Commuter Space Sack Snowboard Bag

comment: Hello Lydia, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our TIVOLI™ V Tall Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Do not buy this boot if you want waterproof boots. Two snow shoeing trips and my boots hold water now do not buy.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are some of the best snow boots I have ever tried on! The material feels so nice and they are super comfortable. Definitely give them a shot as they will probably be your new favorite snow boots
review.name: love these!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these, super cute and comfortable. They are very warm and fuzzy on the inside. I'm excited to see if they will be waterproof in the snow. I'm sure they will keep my feet cozy this winter!
review.name: Love them!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s not even winter, yet and I must say I love these boots. The color is amazing, the inside is so soft. The durability is out of this world. I love the support and comfort and also I like the fact that this booth is waterproof! The fit is perfect and the tread in the book can be great for hiking or snowy days.
review.name: Wow, this boot is amazing!!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The boots are not only comfortable, durable and well made but also really cute.  The fit is perfect and the support is definitely great!  The grip on the bottom is really good too. No slipping.
review.name: Look great and feel great

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so cute and comfortable!! So happy to have these! They are so warm and cozy, plus high enough to keep the snow off! I don't like snow, but can't wait to wear these bad boys around!
review.name: Soft and cozy!!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sizing is a hair narrow.  Wearing a size 9 and receiving a size 9 and wearing med. crew socks these are little snug through the ball of my (slightly wider than average) ball of foot.  Also a hair snug through arch (slightly higher than average).  Had a size 9 friend try on with high arches- snug through arch.  They do seem to have stretched a little wearing some. 
These are surprisingly comfortable for such a thick sole.  The foot bed is comfortable and the rugged sole is not overly heavy and the boot does flex.  
I love how easy these laces pull up to tighten. Can't attest to grip in snow or ice as it's still warm here.
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

name: Tivoli V Tall Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are the greatest teva's of all times !!! I love them!!!! When to a concert in ATL, GA... got so many compliments on this shoe!!!!!!
review.name: I would buy these shoes over & over again'nn

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. I was worried I'd feel unsteady in them because of the thickness of the sole, but it's the exact opposite. I wore these all around Lake Placid right after buying them, and they were so comfortable !!!
review.name: Great sandal

review.reviewBody: Very cute on. I was worried the crochet would make the straps not as strong, but they seem comparable to the normal strap. Classic Teva issue where any foot sweat makes you slide around, which is a little more precarious with the flatform but haven't twisted my ankle yet
review.name: Very cute, flatform a little clunky

review.reviewBody: Fun summer colors. The platform is comfy and gives me some height.
review.name: Cute!

review.reviewBody: Very colorful and comfortable - can't wait to pair them with shorts or dresses this summer
review.name: fun teva!

review.reviewBody: I have previously found Teva's to be very comfortable, so I had high hopes for these funky crocheted, platform lovelies. After wearing them a bunch this week I have a number of rubs forming on my big toe and on the inside of my ankles, which is a real bummer. If I use band-aids to cover these rubs, the shoes become solidly okay, and I'm hoping that proves to be a temporary measure. Beyond the rubs, I'm still getting used to the way my foot needs to grip the sole to walk in a platform shoe. In all candor, I don't love that expenditure of conscious effort given that I'm a city-dweller whose primary mode of transit is her feet.
review.name: They jury is out (but hopeful)

review.reviewBody: I bought my daughters each, a pair of TEVA sandals! They love them, and plan to wear them all thru the summer!!!Thank you TEVA, they are wonderful!!!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I've worn Teva sandals for years, and these don't disappoint. Favorite thing, the SOFT (but still sturdy) strap. The crochet strap is a dressier, current take on the original nylon strap. Comfortable fashion is my favorite way to go! I won't be using these for the water, but for everyday, dressed up or down, these will be my go-to sandal this Spring and Summer. Love them!
review.name: Perfect for summer fun!

name: Flatform Universal Crochet Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th pair of these shorts, because I love them. But this time they seem to be smaller in the waist, so I measured and sure enough they are1 to 1 1/2 inches smaller in the waist then my other pairs. My other shorts were made in China and these were made in Cambodia, not sure if that is the reason??I will be keeping because a hope they stretch out a tad, but making sure I don’t eat six pies over the holidays ;-). I’m 5’7” 135-140 lbs, athletic build. Frustrating because returning on items on Backcountry is not always a pleasant experience.
review.name: Love these shorts but sizing issue
