review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I adore this sleeping bag. I have taken it on one practice trip before a long backpacking trip, and I was very comfortable in about 50 without lots of layers. I love that you can stick your arms and feet out, or even start your morning as a little coffee-drinking caterpillar if it's dry outside. Unfortunately, it poured on our first camping trip, and the bag got a little damp (heartbreak!), but it dried very quickly when I laid it out. No problems so far!
review.name: It's perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a lovely sleeping bag. My only caveat is as I am 5’6” it just fits. I wish I had ordered the long
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The way I am 100% obsessed with this sleeping bag. As a camper, I need a durable good quality one, that will keep me warm but also allow me freedom to move. 
This has snaps at the top so you can keep your chest warm but your arms free and a zippered bottom so you can open up for your feet’s freedom but also have the ability to tuck your feet in and leave it unzipped. 
Used this for camping at a music festival with wind gusts up to 40mph. I was cozy all night!
review.name: OBSESSED

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hands down the absolute best sleeping bag on the market. The women’s one is slightly warmer and more filled than the men’s one. Where my girlfriend sleeps colder than me, it’s absolutely perfect. The women’s and men’s ascent zip together for couples, it packs down to the perfect size to fit into my osprey atmos ag 50 sleeping bag compartment. I’ve used it down to 25 degrees and it is very comfortable. 
Keeps you very warm
Packs down 
zippers work better than any bag I’ve ever used
Sides and bottom unzip so you can use your arms and legs outside of the bag
review.name: SPEND THE MONEY!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a super comfortable bag! Normally, I’m incredibly uncomfortable with a sleeping pad and bag, but the Ascent bag was so cozy! Kept me warm through the night, and the zip downs on the side were great for preventing overheating. It’s a bag that feels nice to slip into after a long day of hiking, and at around one pound, didn’t add to much to my pack. I’m excited to keep using this for the season.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I Love the shape of this sleeping bag and that it’s made for a female body and stature. Can’t wait to take it fall camping , and am excited to break it out this summer. It’s compact and easy to bring along on the road.
review.name: Comfy and warm

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited to have received this sleeping bag! I plan on using it for our upcoming Yosemite trip. The color has two variations of green, which looks great and very eye catching. The durability of this sleeping bag is amazing and I know it will last multiple backpacking trips. The bag it comes in has two handles, making it easy to attach to my backpack using a carabiner at the top. It's super light, and I can roll it even tighter if needed, which is a huge plus for longer hikes. 

I was able to test it out in my living room and it has just enough space to not feel claustrophobic but keep me warm. The amount of down filling is impressive and I’m looking forward to  a comfortable night's sleep after a long day of backpacking Yosemite!
review.name: Green with Backpacking Envy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am in love with this Sea to Summit sleeping bag. It’s the Ascent Women’s Down bag. The color is pretty and I like the aesthetic. It’s super portable. The bag is easy to carry. It can pack down small and is super light. I like all the zipper features. It’s cool that you can zip up but still leave your legs and arms sticking out. It’s very warm inside. The hood is nice as well. The size is perfect for me. Overall this bag is great and I would recommend.
review.name: Really incredible sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received a free Ascent Women’s down sleeping bag by seatosummit in exchange for my honest review. This sleeping bag is extremely well made. The material is so soft and the weight is light as well for backpacking. This is rated to keep you warm in as low as 15 degrees Fahrenheit. The weather near me was not that cold but it is very warm and comfortable. The design is well thought out and I especially like how the head area curves in and can be tightened to keep out the cold. This sleeping bag is the regular size and is large enough for a woman that is 5’7’’. With that being said, I am 5’10 and I weigh 175lbs. Although I am past the recommended height restriction, I was still able to fit in this sleeping bag. My toes were right up against the bottom but it wasn’t uncomfortable. I assume that the long would be even more comfortable for my body type. The color is nice and reminds me of an avocado- dark green on the outside and light green on the inside. There is also a well thought out pocket on the inside for small items such as a phone or keys. For such a warm sleeping bag, I am super impressed with how small it can be folded into. This would be a fantastic addition for any serious hikers/campers who are looking to stay warm after a long day of hiking.
review.name: Compact, warm and well made- extremely durable construction

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is so soft and comfortable!  It feels like your bundled up in clouds.  It’s feels well insulated and it’s easy to pack and unpack from its bag.  It’s a pretty 2 tone green color and I’m sure it will keep me warm camping on chilly nights!
review.name: Soft and fluffy

name: Ascent Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's

review.reviewBody:
This is my third variety of an OR trail mix jacket I've ordered. I'm a big fan of OR's Trail Mix line up. The fleece is comfortable and manages temperature swings well. This particular one I used for both outdoor activities and professional medical settings (EMS black 1/4 zip). I value it a lot for its comfort when going back and forth between cold and warm environments. The abdominal pocket is great, with openings big enough for easy access but not too large that items easily fall out. The small phone sleeve within the pocket is a nice touch for smaller objects. 

Something I've noticed with this quarter-zip is that due to it's more weather-resistant, structure shoulder panel, it has a little less mobility in the shoulders. I have rather broad shoulders so this is something I might notice more than others. While I think the benefits of this design are nice, I'm more prone to grab my original Trail Mix zip-up hoody for more active adventures. 
Final note, good job OR for keeping the chest pocket on this one.
review.name: Great Addition to my Trail Mix arsenal

comment: We are sorry to hear that the top you ordered was not the size you expected. We value your feedback and have sent you an email to discuss this further.

I definitely could have been comfortable in a medium, but the large is perfectly “oversized.” Regardless, the fit is still slimming & the feel is flexible and comfy!

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping this pack would make carrying it every day a no brainer compared to my old BCA pack but nope. 

Pros are:
Definitely the best airbag technology. Don’t have to worry about an airplane, multiple pulls is great, self test is reassuring, I buy the case for deflating in case of a burial, larger airbag to protect from trauma seems good, the between the leg strap is well designed and easy to use, helmet carry is well designed and useful, axe carry is also well done, the avy gear pouch is well designed and very easy to access. The diagonal carry seems pretty good although you need to take off your pack to use it. 

Cons: It is a pretty terrible backpack, the shoulder strap adjustments are hard to use and it doesn’t have any strap on top of your shoulder for pulling the weight in, the hip belt is difficult to cinch and the webbing rolls every single day, while the multiple size attachments are cool they could have done better using straps to allow the pack to expand or contract depending on the day, the bag itself is not very organized, while you can move the zippers to any position for access practically speaking it functions like a top loader which reduces the efficiency of what you can put in there a lot. The result is that it packs smaller than it is. I pretty much always need to carry my 35L attachment unless it’s a really short and simple day. It also doesn’t really have any attachment points on the hip or straps for gear, radio, water bottle, snacks. The pull handle option on both sides is no necessary considering it sacrifices some option for radio/water bottle carry. 

The bottom line is while it’s a great airbag, I’m still always debating whether I am actually going to need/want to bring it and the weight isn’t really the issue it more about just organization and efficiency.
review.name: Carries poorly and inefficient.

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th Jetforce pack and it is awesome. Great for practice and I hope I never have to deploy it to help save my life but I always wear it in case. Hopefully the battery system will last longer than the Pilot 11 very comfortable and good storage space.
review.name: What is your life worth?

review.reviewBody: I had the older version from 2016 and this one is much lighter. It could use some more pockets, but other than that I am very happy. Haven't had to deploy it yet thank god.
review.name: So far it’s great

review.reviewBody:
love my jetforce, convenient storage, fits all the essentials and has a sturdy feel, not floppy on your back like other bags. 
simple controls and deployment as well!
review.name: great bag

review.reviewBody:
Looking for any help on this one! I can't find an answer anywhere!!

Thanks!
review.name: Where do you place a BCA Radio for Backcountry Communication?

review.reviewBody: These packs will come apart. The zipper that holds that cargo portion of these packs on WILL come undone and poof yard sale. The fact that bd hasn’t remedied this boggles my mind as it is one of the worst designs I’ve encountered. You will be in happy with this purchase.
review.name: Design flaws

review.reviewBody: I want to love this bag, but not there yet. As a small rider (5’2”), the smal/medium size is too tall for my frame… I can manage, but it’s definitely designed for taller people. To boot, the back frame is flat and with little support. I’m finding hot spots where it hits a belt loop, for instance. No less, I love the ease of the airbag set up and deployment. Three pockets are good for separation of gear, but admittedly, the airbag takes up a lot of space in the main compartment. Finding that I have to adjust what I pack in the bag. I’d love to see the split board specific bag in the larger size.
review.name: Almost…

review.reviewBody: This bag is the final addition in a backcountry setup, especially when you are in steep terrain. The multi-pulls on a charge offers you the peace of mind to deploy the airbag even if you think there's something, or if there is. It's the peace of mind that gives you the extra confidence out in the backcountry. Additionally, the design is well thought out, with a compartment for the essentials (beacon/shovel/probe) and enough room inside the pack for a day tour or an overnight trip.
review.name: Peace of mind

name: Jetforce Pro Split 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Low Ankle cuff makes for loose fit, Buckles all a pain to adjust before each run. Liners difficult to remove and reinsert for daily drying  especially if you have stick on boot fitting shims. Wire broke and started unravelling  after 8 days use!!  I  recommend WOULD NOT recommend to anyone. I bought because I have wide feet and wish I could take them back but had them blown out even wider. Super dissapointed in this product.
review.name: Poor Engineering
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Exceptional boot, very comfortable. Great uphill and high ski performance.
review.name: Excellent touring boot.

review.reviewBody:
Salomon did it with the S/Lab Mtn Summit.
It’s the perfect blend of lightweight and powerful stiff. This boot wants to run up the mountain and rip down.
review.name: The perfect skimo boot..

review.reviewBody:
Bought this to replace some very well loved (and old in the tooth) MTN labs from ages ago that are still good but I figured an upgrade was in order.

Fit: the toebox is definitely roomier than the older MTN labs which is a big plus. Last seems similar and you can heat mould of course. However, the actual length is shorter by a few mm - and there's a significant difference in BSL (about 12mm for a 28.5 boot). Will likely need to get them punched for my big toe. My foot definitely feels way snugger in these which is great (more of an alpine racing fit). For ref, I own 27.5 S/Pro 130's and the fit is almost as tight as my 28.5 Summits.

Overall impressions: I like the BOA - will see how it survives deep bootpacking adventures up couloirs. The main buckle provides enough range to get decent ROM when you flip it open, but you likely will want to reposition the velcro strap. The powerstrap though needs improvement -  I find it annoying (position, length and lack of adjustable buckle means you're going to fiddle with it during every transition). Still early season in the Canadian Rockies so haven't charged hard yet with the boots, but they were driving my 106 skis without any problem. The boot does tend to buckle outward at the ankle when you really drive shin pressure though - more so than my older MTN Labs.

What I don't like: the liner ... might be lightweight, but I immediately switched the stock liner for my Intuition Pro Tours ... 

Weight: my older MTN Labs came in at 1590g each boot - this one came in at 1305g (with the stock liner).

Other note: given the significantly shorter BSL as compared to the MTN Lab, expect to have to reposition your bindings (at min your rear piece will need to move up).

Overall, I'm quite happy with the purchase, subject to the above.
review.name: Solid boot - improvements would make it perfect

review.reviewBody: i just try it in shop and i just realize that the size of boots from the wide are to tight for my foot ps got so problem i don’t know if i can heat those or not ?
review.name: i just try it on shop
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace a Scarpa F1 LT that was fitted too big, and wanted to try this instead. Overall, it’s a great boot with a slightly wider toe box than the F1 LT. The ski/walk switch is probably the best feature of the boot. On the up, the ROM and weight make it just as walkable as the F1 LT. On the down, I was slightly less confident with this boot than the F1 LT. It has a more progressive flex, but it does feel not as supportive as the F1 LT despite advertising that it’s stiffer. Overall a solid boot.
review.name: Great lightweight boot

review.reviewBody:
Did around 150 000 vertically meeters in this boot. 
Skied skis between 80-106 underfoot.
The boot has enough Power to handle skis to around 100 waist. It depends a little how hard you want to ski.
They handle the 106 good, i would reccomend to use this boot for skis up to 100 waist. And that is really good for a boot in this segment.
The boot is easy to use, transition from walk to ski and vice versa is good and trustable.
Doing long days outside in this boot is great. They have a a good liner, and keep you warm. 
Sizing: i use 42 2/3 in Salomon running shoes.
I choosed 26,5 in this model. Needed to block them a little, and they feels great. ( I like skiboots to have a sensitive fit)
review.name: Light skiboot with great performance

review.reviewBody: It has been a few years since I have been this excited about a new ski touring boot. I have had this boot for a couple months now and have done about 15 days touring in them. They walk as good as any boot I have used and have little to no restriction in range of motion. For a ~1000g boot it skis well with a similar flex patter to the previous X-Alp. Transitions are super easy with a BOA on the forefoot and a single strap/buckle on the cuff along with a booster strap. The fit feels true to size and after heat molding and a couple punches for my bunions, they are perfect. My biggest complaint is that they are difficult to get on and off because of how tight the gaiter is and my high instep. I think with more use it should stretch out and become easier. I would definitely recommend this boot for anyone looking for a dedicated touring boot focused on uphill performance.
review.name: Perfect light touring boot!

review.reviewBody: I've had two renditions of this boot over the years and it might the only touring boot I ever purchase. As someone who spends more time in touring boots than alpine boots during the winter, I've put these boots through the test over several seasons. They are light on the uphill and consistently impressive on the down in every condition. The best quality about this boot is the construction won't let you down when in the backcountry. You can count on them in every way you need to while touring. Also, the rubber bottoms have great grip while scrambling on rock during a bootpack. Only suggestion: add a Booster strap for more support.
review.name: Light, Durable, and Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Im not sure what to say. I am shocked that such a light boot can preform so well. It is everything I always wanted and more. Beefy enough to ski most skis, and walks like a dream. Also small details like a bigger toe box keep my feet happy even on the epics where I’m in them for much longer than expected.
review.name: Best boot ever

name: S/Lab MTN Summit Touring Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and warm for usual winter hikes. But it's not for extreme cold weather. For 7k summits you need something else. But it fits to my requirements and I really like it.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Rab Neutrino Pro for a big trek and have tested it out in the rather cold Kansas weather (outings in below 0 deg. F) and the coat performed extremely well. Comfortable over several layers, easy to adjust, easy to move in, maneuver gear. Very pleased.
review.name: So far so great!

review.reviewBody: Purchased to have a warmer puffy for mountaineering. Super impressed with how light and warm this thing is! Keeps me warm for summits at high altitude (12-18k). Doesn't pack down as small as my "ghost-whisperer" but it's sooo much warmer... Also good for dog walking here in Colorado. Usually purchase a small; Still had a good amount of room to go on top of other layers at summits. Solid piece of gear.
review.name: Favorite Puffy

review.reviewBody:
Got this for wear around town. Where I live the winter wind is normally 20-35 mph with gusts to 60 mph. Temps in winter teens and twenties, but single digits not uncommon. Last year two days in December -30.

At a temp of 29 degrees, wind about 20 mph this jacket is not warm. One sleeve has a cold spot near crook in arm.
review.name: Not warm

review.reviewBody: Got this jacket for trek last summer to K2 in Pakistan for staying warm in camp. Did well with temps down to low-mid 20s F. Also used for late season backpacking with temps to low 30s in camp and kept me warm - and light and compressible enough to fit in ultralight pack with total weight of 27 lbs. Now I am wearing it whenever I get a chance - even for walks in city! Features like hood and its adjustment, zippers, waist cinch, high neck are well-designed. Fabric is strong and shed light precip. Love it.
review.name: Great for K2 trek/Cascades bakcpakcing

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for a friend who lives in Canada. When it arrived it was flat and did not feel warm at all when I wore it outside. I've hung it outside overnight and hopefully the air moving through it will make it look like the ad photo. I will update this review once my friend tries it in the Canadian outdoors.
review.name: Not sure how warm this is going to be...

review.reviewBody: On sizing, I am 5’10”, 175 pounds, 40” chest, 32” waist. Medium was a nice fit with room for a sweater. Like the length and hood. Odd to say - but with so many jackets having weak zippers (Arctyrex) the zipper on this jacket is robust!  Zips great and feels hearty!  This is a great jacket to wear on bitter cold days. I have no suggestions on improvement. Worth consideration!
review.name: Warm - as advertised!

review.reviewBody:
I last had a down outer garment when I was a teenager, but now I wonder why I waited so long to get reacquainted. There’s something magical about wearing something that you can barely detect that keeps you so warm.

I tried on and returned this RAB model. It’s a great jacket, featuring a truly useful hood that fits the head/face very well. However, I embarked upon additional RAB product research, and I settled on the Infinity jacket for improved wind resistance,  increased insulation weight, and its differentiated shell construction. 

I’m a 44-45 chest, 38 waist, 171/2 neck and 34-35 sleeve; the XL fit me about perfectly.
review.name: Nice all around piece

name: Neutrino Pro Jacket - Men's
Rab Men’s Neutrino Pro Jacket | GH Review

description: Buy the Garmin Edge 840 Solar Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Edge 840 Solar Bike Computer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Edge 840 Solar Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought 3 weeks ago and do not disappoint. All features are great, and the touchless screen is fantastic. Great deal.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I replaced my old 530. This is a definite upgrade. Touch screen is awesome. Solar charging is…ok I guess.  I haven’t ridden long enough to see a real charge yet plus it is cloudy all day here in Michigan this time of year.
review.name: Perfect for me

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago but there is one thing that I cant figure out. I cant figure out how to make it estimate watts. Other then that it is a amazing piece of equipment.
review.name: it works amazing

review.reviewBody:
First I like the form factor, the buttons and touch screen are awesome UI is fast and routing is great. 

If I had to do it again I wouldn’t get the solar, the battery gain from solar is negligible, even on 100mi rides. And screen quality suffers from the solar glass. 

I wish the screen was bigger without increasing the overall shape, there seems like a lot of wasted space in the bezel. 

Room for improvement: 

The garmin struggles to sync with the phone after activities I have to close and reopen start and restart the unit multiple times before activities are uploaded. In some case activities aren’t uploaded at all. 

Other than that I love it it’s better than wahoo or hammerhead.
review.name: GPS is super accurate but bugs

review.reviewBody:
Ever since the 520, all Garmin units have had serious connection issues. 530, 830, 540 and now the 840. They all lose connections intermittently during the ride (frequently lose radar/phone etc. connections). After completing rides, they seldom sync without several tries and most often "forcing" a sync several times. Please spend less time on stupid features like pay and group stuff and fix the numerous and well documented connection issues with these units. 

The display is glossy and hard to see in direct sunlight and the touch screen is basically non-responsive. The solar is a completely useless feature. Again, please just fix the basics of these units first please before offering crap at a higher price that no one needs?
review.name: Same old Garmin issues

review.reviewBody: This is a great unit. The appealing feature for me was the Solar charging capability. It has so, so many features that, although good to have, is a little overwhelming to get yourself accustomed to it. Initially you have to spend a bit of time turning off and configuring it the way you like it. But the unit works great and the Solar charging is a huge plus.
review.name: So many features

review.reviewBody: I like it but it’s taking a while to figure it out
review.name: Complicated

review.reviewBody:
Have had it for about a month. It regularly doesn’t connect to watch, di2, powermeter if left in sleep mode after saving a ride. But that’s the default for the power button. It’s annoying to have to fully turn it off and on each time when I commute daily and the battery should last at least a week in sleep mode.

Could not find a fix on forums, Reddit or online.
review.name: Started great, doesn’t consistently connect….
comment:
Thank you for your review and experience with the Edge 840 Solar. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

Edge 840 Solar Support:
https://support.garmin.com/en-US/?productID=798946&tab=topics

review.reviewBody: Amazing simplicity of setting up my new Garmin! Scan the QR reader and all my information, page layouts, etc. are loaded in!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: The face is larger than I expected as compared to the Garmin 1030.

Buy the Shimano SM-RT76 Rotor - 6 Bolt online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SM-RT76 Rotor - 6 Bolt
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano SM-RT76 Rotor - 6 Bolt online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Shimano's RT86 "Ice Tech" line might get most of the attention, but their ancestral RT76s still get the job done.

RT76s aren't quite as light because only the carrier is aluminum; the rotor is good ol' reliable steel. The upside of this is that RT76s tend to last longer and hold up to abuse better as compared to the aluminum-and-steel sandwich offered in the RT86s.

The RT76s are also more forgiving of brake pad material (resin, ceramic or sintered metallic).

Can't go wrong with either, but if price and versatility are your top concerns, the RT76 might be your best option.
review.name: Humble Yet Capable

review.reviewBody: Fit and quality are very good.  Must be made to very close tolerance at no caliper adjustment was needed when this replaced the sold Shimano rotor.
review.name: Direct replacement for old rotor

review.reviewBody: Increasing the rotor size from 160 to 180mm was the right choice for loaded touring on highways and trails. I appreciate the control and added surface area that this larger disc provides. An adapter is required when upsizing and Backcountry sells the adapter too.
review.name: For touring, bigger is better!

name: SM-RT76 Rotor - 6 Bolt

description: Buy the POC Vpd Air+ Tee online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vpd Air+ Tee
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Vpd Air+ Tee online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vpd Air+ Tee
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Vpd Air+ Tee online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Light weight, fits well, aerated (as much as you would expect from a body armor.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody:
With respect to other reviewers, I think this is a somewhat under-rated product.

In summary, if you wanted to have poc's "Air"-level protection all-around + a beefier (eg "Air+") back, this is as close as you get.

Comparing to the Spine 2 Jacket (vpd 2 back) and the VPD Tee (air back + air elbows)..

VPD Tee (long sleeve version with no chest or shoulder protection) has an "Air" back, 3-layer thinner layers, ~360g, all perforated. VPD Air Tee (this one) has an "Air+" back, 3 thicker layers, ~550g, less perforations in the center. VPD Spine 2 jacket is an even beefier, VPD 2 back.

Weirdly, the velcro piece for the cummerbund is there on this Air Tee, but it doesn't come in the package.

Shoulders are certainly better fitting on the VPD Spine. Spine uses the vpd2 molded material, VPD Air Tee (this one) uses the same thing as air knee and elbows, eg a cut sheet (not molded). VPD Tee (long sleeve) has no shoulder protection.

Chest plate here is a a single thicker layer, certainly less beefy (but also much lighter) than the chest on Spine 2. It's very wearable just-in-case.

If the shoulders fit ok, this seems like it could work for a lot of people. I sent back the Spine 2, it is beautiful and not much more relatively speaking but too heavy duty for me. Long-sleeve VPD Tee is really a great XC thing, with light back, air elbows, and three huge stash pockets. I'll probably keep this Air Tee for DH in combination with separate air elbows, though will swap in the lighter back from the long-sleeve.

Can confirm that there are no arm grippers, unfortunately.
review.name: Seems quite good

review.reviewBody:
I have the VPD Spine 2.0 jacket, which I like. Tried this since I wanted something cooler. The 'tee' is completely redundant to the 2.0 jacket. Physically comparing both side by side: the material (not the pads) is identical on both. Zero difference. The tee's shoulder pads are not as nicely shaped as the 2.0, with a weird hump over the shoulder. The chest pad is one-piece here vs. three thinner layers on the 2.0. The latter is oddly much more flexible than what you get here. This tee does not come with the cummerbund thing that the 2.0 jacket does. Both have a superb closure system with the zipper. Fit in the L/XL size for me is great: 5'11", 185lbs, 43.5" chest. Shoulder pads are not removable here, back and chest panels are. VPD 2.0 jacket is the same. I do prefer the back panel here, which is three independent layers vs one giant VPD board on the 2.0. The only conceivable way this is cooler than the 2.0 is the slightly larger perforations in the back panel. That's it. And the tech features listed say it's level 1 protection, but the actual jacket says it's level 2 (back only). Which brings me to my final point:

POC: your technical descriptions suck real bad. For example, which is it? Level 1 or 2? Your write-up for this 'tee' says it has silicone below the elbows to keep the sleeves in place, and refers to sleeve padding. This product obviously has neither BECAUSE IT IS A TEE. If you're going to ask a lot of money for your products, don't make people guess which features they actually have.
review.name: Pointless. Buy the Spine 2.0 jacket
comment: Re whether shoulder goes over the ac joint, I would not rely on it. Better to think of those pads same as air knees and elbows. They'd cushion direct impact to the shoulder and a bit around it, more down the arm than up towards the neck.
Well does the shoulder pad go over the shoulder?  More specifically the AC joint?

name: Vpd Air+ Tee

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat shortly before my mid-December trip to Iceland. If I had had any doubts about staying warm in that climate, they were soon put to rest. I stayed warm throughout the entire trip, even while hiking in sub zero temperatures. I tried on a "higher rated" coat, but it was too heavy and bulky and I didn't believe it would keep me any warner. I'm glad I shopped on Backcountry; they gave me the best deal.
review.name: Warm in Coldest Weather

review.reviewBody: I have been looking to invest in a warm, good looking parka that doesn't totally break the bank, but staying warm might have no cost. This met all of my expectations. I live in Cleveland and it was 22 degrees this morning, but the wind was awful. I wore a t shirt underneath and I was warm! I am also on a beta blocker so keeping warm is really hard for me. this coat is awesome, thanks for helping me!
review.name: so happy with this purchase

review.reviewBody: ALL I CAN SAY BUY THIS COAT, ITS VERY WARM THE QUALITY AND LENGTH IS PERFECT. THIS COAT WILL NOT DISAPPOINT YOU. I HAD THIS COAT FOR OVER 6 YEARS IN GREY AND MY COAT STILL LOOK NEW AS IF I BOUGHT IT TODAY. THIS COAT IS WORTH EVERY PENNY. GET THIS COAT !!!!
review.name: NOT THE BEST!

review.reviewBody: I love this coat. It's very warm even in weather as low as the teens. It hasn't been colder than that to try. The fit is true to size. My only drawback is I wish the hood was adjustable. The wind blows it down sometimes. This has nothing to do with the coat itself, but I was very disappointed when I saw that this coat was marked down by 30% on Cyber Monday! Lesson learned!
review.name: I would buy this coat again but wait for a sale

review.reviewBody: I had on a lightweight turtleneck with no extra layers and I felt completely toasty outside in 26F weather. This is a great coat, not too heavy, and very warm while being easy to move around in. I love the knit cuffs to block wind, and the snaps to button if I don't need to zip up. I am 5'2", 137lbs, and ordered a Medium to allow extra room for thick sweaters. The only downside is that the sleeves are about an inch too long but it is not a dealbreaker. A little pricey but so far it is worth the investment.
review.name: Great purchase so far

review.reviewBody: I have a grey & black one! Size up if you like to layer your clothes. Very warm and great quality .
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Purchased in October and finally wore in December with a lightweight turtleneck and was toasty in 26F windy weather. It is well-made and functional. 5'2" 137lbs ordered M for layering room.
review.name: Great purchase so far

review.reviewBody: Loved it. Very warm. Even when it gets warm and you walk indoors with it, you don't feel the need to immediately remove it. It's almost like thermal regulating. Even in high winds in the cold of Chicago, Paris and Seattle, I was very comfortable!
review.name: Love it! Worth the money

review.reviewBody: I have had mine for several years and aside from the white eventually needing tto be replaced I adore the jacket
review.name: The best winter coat

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed in this jacket. It's not warm at all. I wore three shirt layers and two pant layers and my arms and legs were cold and I could feel cold air coming through in 25 degrees weather.
review.name: Not warm, very disappointed

hasVariant.name: Archeon 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 40L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Archeon 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 40L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been buying Osprey packs since 1989, while I was a student at UC Santa Cruz—and the packs were made in SC. I’ve probably owned over 30 Osprey packs over the years. However, I’ve been incredibly disappointed in their designs in the past few years. The Archeon 40
is yet another example of the decline of Osprey. The material is ridiculously thick and unmanageable. I don’t know why they would use this material, since it’s just a travel bag. It’s not meant for drastic conditions. Secondly, the zippers are so tight that you can’t hardly open and close them. In short, I would absolutely not recommend this pack. Honestly, I can’t believe this pack even passed their design and use inspections.
review.name: Would not recommend!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the bag, the zippers are a little tight, and already lost the top zipper puller. Apart from that good and robust
review.name: Love the bag, the zippers

review.reviewBody:
I just got this pack and used it for a long weekend in Seattle. It completely exceeded my expectations and the fabric is perfect for those rainy PNW days.
This might be my new favorite carry-on travel pack.
review.name: New Favorite Carry-On

name: Archeon 40L Backpack

description: Buy the Backcountry GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have had a lot of fleece jackets over the years and this is by far the best. I am a pretty typical medium but can swing to a large. For comfort. I went with a large in this for a loose baggy fit and for extra sleeve length and it’s perfect. I have worn it every day. It’s high quality, flattering, comfortable, warm, super cute, and worth every penny. 

I bought it on sale but I would buy more if they came out in other colors.
review.name: Obsessed

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very soft fleece and love the loose/slightly boxy fit. Best thing is how many pockets it got! There’re also smaller mesh pockets within the large pockets to keep your small items organized. And there’s even a pocket on the back!
review.name: Favorite fleece! So many pockets 😍

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am in love with the goat fleece. So cozy and warm! I love the shape and fit of this jacket. I like that it is a double zipper so I can zip up from the bottom too. I am 5' 9". Usually 140 lbs but got the XL because I am currently pregnant and wanted something baggier to fit the bump. Honestly stoked with the baggy fit and planning to keep wearing even after baby comes.
review.name: So cozy!

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Y’all.
It’s been super cold (for our area) this last week, so I was stoked to get my new jacket. I purchased the Sandpiper (small) and wore it over a tank top. A TANK TOP. Left the house and it was 14° outside with a windchill of 2°.
I was warm and toasty! It is wind resistant, super soft, and the pockets are amazing! I was able to leave my purse and take my necessities using the pockets- and I had room to spare! Worth the price! I was excited to get it on sale, but I would absolutely pay retail price for it knowing how warm I was today. Tomorrow, I will leave my heavy, thick, bulky,
The North Face coat at home and use my
Backcountry GOAT Fleece Jacket while I am on bus duty at school! It will be about 20° in the morning, so this jacket will be perfect!! And I LOVE it isn’t bulky!
review.name: OMG! Warmest Fleece Jacket EVER!

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: You can't see in the picture, but this top has a full back pocket that you can access from either side and zip close.  It's perfect for casual wear and great to hike in for fall, especially with all the pockets.  Love the fabric, I have animals and the outside of the fabric doesn’t keep hair attached to it like a regular fleece, it’s amazing.  Fabric is also great on the inside against skin.  Would buy this again!   I also bought this oversized for a little more room in the body and it doesn't look sloppy at all, fit is amazing.
review.name: Love all the pockets and super soft!

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the inside fabric - soft and warm. Zippers and pockets are great and creative. Outside fabric makes the look different than other similar pieces on the market.
review.name: So Cozy!!

review.itemreviewed: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The fleece inside is so soft against the skin. I love all the pockets and the pockets in pockets. Who needs a purse or hip pack, when you can just put everything in here!
review.name: So comf!

name: GOAT Fleece Zip Front Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use the Anacapa Breeze Mid for hiking...just got them so for now I wear them for trail inspections. Plan to give them a shot at trail maintenance soon. Not as confident that they'll hold up in wet weather conditions, but didn't purchase them for that. Lightweight and very comfortable. I do cut that backstrap on all boots since they often get caught up in the other boot and can be a tripping hazard. Otherwise completely pleased thus far!
review.name: Wonderful good weather hiking boot

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: As a first responder I needed a pair of boots comfortable enough to carry me for 12 to 16 hours a day. These boots delivered 110%.
review.name: Best boots on the market

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The first pair that I bought where the shoe string attached to the shoe ripped the very first time I lace them up, and now the pair I got to replace them the webbing that attaches the tongue of to the rest of the shoe is ripping out! Overall quality is terrible!
review.name: I would not purchase this product again!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband loves these shoes for his workouts. The high top design stabilizes his ankles and prevents injury. He wants to order a second pair in case they are discontinued when he needs a new pair in the future.
review.name: Anacapa Breeze Mid

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My son-in-law loves these boots. He is on his feet sometimes 16 hours a day, minimal leg and foot discomfort at the end of the day!!
review.name: Anacapa boots

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Anacapa Breeze Mid makes a loud noise when walking on the concrete tile floor. I had these for some time and the noise does not go away. Do you have any ideas on how to make them less noisy?
review.name: Would buy a boot more stealthy.

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The hook for the shoe laces broke off after less than 10 years
review.name: Do not recommend

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for work. I wore them for 2 weeks and one of the hooks that are used to lace up the shoes broke. The big thing is now that it's broken i can't lace up the shoe.
review.name: These shoes are comfy. There's a bug issue

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes squeak so loud it is down right embarrassing to walk down a hall. Like the fit comfortable But Customer care is a looping joke . This was my 4 th purchased pair Will not be spending money on this brand again.
review.name: Noisy

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The eye that hold shoe strong in place broke after less than 10 wears.
review.name: Do not buy

name: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Kitchen Sink
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Kitchen Sink online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an excellent product, durable and very useful.
review.name: Great kitchen sink!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is surprisingly durable give y its weight. It collapses to a very small size for storage and the design is very clever. This is great for more than just washing your dishes when out in the field. I highly recommend adding this to your kit, especially for primitive campers who require products to be multifunctional.
review.name: Lightweight, durable, multifunctional item.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This wash bin packs up small, is lightweight, and does what it's supposed to. Would recommend for any excursion.
review.name: Everything and the kitchen sink

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this to use as a kitchen sink a bathing sink, kind of a do all water source away from the water! It's big enough to wash my size 13 feet, do dishes or use a wash rag and bath myself. Great item, might get a 20 ltr later on.
review.name: Kayak camping wash all

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight and just the right size for cleaning my coffee cup!!
review.name: Light weight and just the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Our "kitchen sink" from Sea to Summit is used to take water away from the water source and use the basin for bathing. 10L size is perfect amount of water for two people. We don't have any dishes backpacking always eating right out of the freeze dried food containers. Bingo !! Wilderness wipes are a delightful must for daily visits to the bushes with trowel in hand.
review.name: Must haves

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product based on the lable description which indicates `completely free-standing` only to discover that it is only free-standing when filled with 8.5 litres of water. In the context of camping this made the sink almost completely useless, firstly it will only be useful if you can access at least 8.5l of water, not mention the waste of water, even if you have easy access. When filled with 8.5l of water it is difficult to carry, and even on a flat picnic table it wibbles, wobbles and then overflows when items are added to it. I contacted Sea to Summit to request a refund which was refused as the purchase was not made directly with them. I was very disappointed that they do not stand by their products and product descriptions. Conclusion - do not purchase this product it is misleading and ineffective.
review.name: Very misleading and useless product

review.reviewBody: I have gone through 4 of these kitchen sinks at various sizes (5L-20L). After every trip ends, the kitchen sink has a hole somewhere. Doesn’t matter how careful you are, it will puncture. Great idea, but the material is horrible.
review.name: Will Break Immediately

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] LIght and functional, the Sink is more of a "nice to have" than a "need to have," but for the tiny extra added weight, it was a big convenience in keeping the dishes clean.
review.name: Added convenience for negligible extra weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a really solid addition to any back country kitchen. The versatility of these collapsible basins from holding water for filtering drinking water to simply cleaning up camp has made them an integral part of my go to gear. Having the extra space to wash large items is definitely a bonus.
review.name: Backcountry kitchen

name: Kitchen Sink
Kitchen Sink

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent and comfortable shirt. Keeps cool and blocks sun
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Terrible. Did not even wear the shirt and a huge pull at the bottom of it!
review.name: Quality very poor!
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.reviewBody: Like most of the 1 Star ratings, mine is a stitching problem. I’ve been wearing these shirts for over 7 years. I have about 10 of them. I still have my original shirts from 7 years ago. The stitching in these old ones is intact. I just purchased 3 new ones. All 3 have had stitching issues. I’ve returned one of them twice. I just washed the new (3rd) one and the bottom hem stitching came completely out. I’m going to have to return it again. My wife has repaired the other 2, which, so far, haven’t fallen completely apart. Here’s my question Columbia; why are you allowing this to happen?  Based on reviews, it’s been happened for at least 10 months. These are great shirts for water sports enthusiasts. For the sake of those of us who love these shirts, please figure this out.
review.name: Poor stitching quality
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shot to wear out on a hot summer day!!!!!!!!!
review.name: Black and blue shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fully effective against summer sun and winter cold.
review.name: Comfortable and Effective

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these shirts.  My son introduced me to them about 2-3 years ago and they have been my go-to shirts ever since for their comfort, clean look, and easy maintenance.  My dermatologist also appreciates that I am wearing a UPF 50 sunblock shirt.
review.name: Original PFG Terminal Tackle Long Sleeve Shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality but poor sizing. Columbia needs to join the global standards. I wear a LG in everything so I ordered a LG. I know Colu mbia recommends I order a medium but it's hard to trust recommendations from companies. I trust my own purchase history more. Wow! When I received this shirt it was way too big! The rest of the World would call it an extra LG or even 2X LG. I already cut the tags off so I'm going to attempt to dry the crap out of it on high heat in an attempt to shrink it.
review.name: Good quality, bad sizing

review.reviewBody: Bought this shirt for my husband to wear deep sea fishing.  I washed it prior to wearing it, it was worn once then washed a second time.  During the second wash, the entire hem came out of the back side of the shirt.  Now I am being advised that I have to return the shirt (at MY EXPENSE) for evaluation to see if it can be repaired.  Just my opinion, a picture should be more than sufficient to show the defective product.
review.name: POOR QUALITY
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.reviewBody: I took this out of the package last week.  Wore it twice and the stitching on the sleeve unraveled.  Once it starts there’s no stopping it.  I guess I just got a bad one.  The PFG products are usually great.
review.name: Cuff unraveled after wearing it twice.
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.reviewBody: Not great quality. Stitching unraveling on cuff after one use. I own several Columbia products but this one I won't consider again and I suggest to find something else. I bought other sizes as matching set with my kids and one of there's is also doing it.
review.name: Disappointed with quality
comment: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

name: Terminal Tackle Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Helly Hansen Powderqueen Infinity Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Powderqueen Infinity Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helly Hansen Powderqueen Infinity Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love it , it’s warm and waterproof, I don’t have this color
review.name: Nice coat

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size, comfortable, stylish, and great features. I'm 5'2, 110lbs and purchased an XS. Slightly tailored look without actually being fitted to the body/restrictive at all.  Length is appropriate for what this jacket is intended for - backcountry and powder days. Purchased with matching bibs from another site and absolutely love the combo.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Despite other reviews, I find this jacket to be true to size. I am 5’6, 135lbs and a medium fits very well. The jacket in my opinion is proper length and covers my backside, the powder skirt is an added benefit. For Warmer days, the jacket alone sufficed with a thin base layer. I did get to test the jacket on a very cold and windy day, held up well with two thinner base layers,  I did not get cold once.  The placement of pockets on the jacket are convenient and I was even able to carry my water bottle in the front pocket one day. Another benefit of this jacket is the high zip front with vents, can be worn without a neck gaiter. Added benefit is the spruce color which is a deep beautiful green.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: I really like the color and the feel of the jacket.  Just really disappointed that zipper on the jacket is not working and it was a pretty expensive purchase.
review.name: Zipper Not Working On Jacket

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’1” and this jacket is too long. Length feels like it’s a dress. Returning is a pain. I have to pay to return it. What a bummer!
review.name: Not for petite

name: Powderqueen Infinity Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Thule Accent 17L Laptop Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Accent 17L Laptop Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Accent 17L Laptop Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased to travel from
Mountains to Manhattan for business. Needed durability and functionality.  Only thing I would change is padding on shoulder strap. It needs to be a bit more “grippy” to avoid slipping off shoulder.
review.name: Great functionality, durability and design.

review.reviewBody:
2nd Thule laptop big, wish it was a bit smaller - Does hold allot more that expected, use it as an overnight bag along with all my business items 
strap is nice on the shoulder
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: I rarely write reviews, frankly because I'm a product professional and I expect the best and rarely find it.   I have a rule that I never want to pay full retail for anything because I know what product costs to make and I understand retail math and again, rarely see the value in most products.    This product is DIFFERENT.   I paid full retail and would do it again tomorrow.  This bag is so well designed.  It is durable, stands up, yet is flexible.  Every pocket is very well thought out in terms of size, closure, location and reinforcement.  Just amazing.   I've been carrying a bag for over 30 years and have been disappointed with nearly every brand.  Thule crushed this bag.  If you're on the fence, just buy. it.  You'll be blown away.
review.name: Game Changer

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using it for a few weeks and I love it best laptop bag I’ve ever had. Quality is outstanding, lots of different spaces to organize all of your stuff. I find it quite comfortable to carry it around even when it’s on the heavier side. Definitely recommend
review.name: Excellent

name: Accent 17L Laptop Bag

review.reviewBody: I want to love this item, and I am trying, yet for some reason, Whitespace gear often has sleeves that are a bit short. I am 6ft, 4, and many other items I purchase that are XL fit fine on the arm length. The item is quality and lined, yet I wish the pockets were more reinforced. They are made of the same material as the liner, which seems a bit prone to wear. If you are shorter in the arms, it will be fine. However, I am considering a return.
review.name: Good style, yet sleeves too short
